semantiva.data_operations package

Submodules

semantiva.data_operations.data_operations module

class semantiva.data_operations.data_operations.AlgorithmTopologyFactory

Bases: object

A factory that creates algorithm classes for specific (input, output) data-type pairs.

classmethod create_algorithm(input_type, output_type, class_name='GeneratedAlgorithm')

Dynamically creates a subclass of DataAlgorithm that expects input_type as input and produces output_type as output.

Parameters:

  • input_type (type) – The expected input data type (subclass of BaseDataType).

  • output_type (type) – The output data type (subclass of BaseDataType).

  • class_name (str) – The name to give the generated class.

Returns:

A new subclass of DataAlgorithm with the specified I/O data types.

Return type:

type

class semantiva.data_operations.data_operations.BaseDataOperation(logger=None)

Bases: ABC, Generic[T]

Abstract base class for all data operations in the semantic framework.

This class defines the foundational structure for implementing data processing operations, ensuring consistency and extensibility.

Parameters:

logger (Logger | None)

get_operation_parameter_names()

Retrieve the names of parameters required by the _operation method.

Returns:

A list of parameter names (excluding data).

Return type:

List[str]

abstract classmethod input_data_type()

Define the type of input data required for the operation.

Returns:

The expected input data type.

Return type:

type

logger: Optional[Logger]
classmethod output_data_type()

Define the type of input data required for the operation.

Returns:

The expected input data type.

Return type:

type

process(data, *args, **kwargs)

Execute the operation with the given data.

Parameters:

  • data (BaseDataType) – The input data for the operation.

  • *args – Additional positional arguments for the operation.

  • **kwargs – Additional keyword arguments for the operation.

Returns:

The result of the operation.

Return type:

Any

class semantiva.data_operations.data_operations.DataAlgorithm(context_observer=None, logger=None)

Bases: BaseDataOperation

Represents a concrete data algorithm within the semantic framework.

This class extends BaseDataOperation to incorporate contextual updates using a ContextObserver.

Parameters:

  • context_observer (ContextObserver | None)

  • logger (Logger | None)

context_observer

An observer for managing context updates.

Type:

ContextObserver

context_keys()

Retrieve the list of valid context keys for the algorithm.

This method defines the context keys that the algorithm can update during its execution. Subclasses need to implement this method to provide a list of keys that are relevant to their specific functionality.

Returns:

A list of strings representing valid context keys.

Return type:

List[str]

Example

For an algorithm that generates a ‘status’ key and an ‘error_count’ key in the context, this method should return: [“status”, “error_count”]

context_observer: Optional[ContextObserver]
class semantiva.data_operations.data_operations.DataProbe(logger=None)

Bases: BaseDataOperation

Represents a probe operation for monitoring or inspecting data.

This class can be extended to implement specific probing functionalities.

Parameters:

logger (Logger | None)
